title.rendered: Find Rooms for Rent in Eugene

content.rendered:
Eugene, Oregon is the second-largest city in the U.S., and it’s no secret. What you may not know is that with everything Eugene has to offer – from the culture to the people and activities – it’s also seen as a hub of innovation. If you love the outdoors and recreational activities, you will absolutely love Eugene! Let’s dive into what life is really like in the big city and help you find rooms for rent in Eugene.

Related: Find Rooms For Rent In Springfield, IL

Getting to know Eugene

Located in the Willamette Valley, Eugene is known for its mild and sunny weather, making it an ideal place to enjoy various outdoor activities year-round. The city gives its residents a mixture of urban and suburban life. It’s small enough that you can get around easily, and you’ll find the people are friendly. The food is great and there is lots to do with your friends.

If you’re looking to move to a small city with a lot going on, looking for rooms for rent in Eugene is a good place to start.

Finding rooms for rent in Eugene

Find Rooms For Rent In Eugene

So, you’re moving to an unfamiliar city. There are a lot of things to do and to check. If you’re looking for rooms for rent in Eugene then we have got your back! Based on recent research, Eugene has around 48% renter-occupied households, and 51% owner-occupied homes.

Neighborhoods where you can find cheaper rooms for rent in Eugene include Corvallis, Redmond, and Gresham – where the average rent is around $1350 or less.

Neighborhoods with rooms for rent in Eugene that are more expensive include Hillsboro, Portland, Wilsonville, and Beaverton where the average rent would be $1,400 or more.

Top neighbourhoods in Eugene

Laurel Hill

Life in Laurel Hill Valley is as beautiful as the name itself. If you have ever been to a small town, you know how lovely it can be. The people are friendlier, the pace is slower and there’s a strong sense of community. Laurel Hill Valley is just such a place. If you are looking for rooms rent in Eugene and like a small-town vibe then Laurel Hill is the neighborhood for you!

Fairmount

Life in Fairmount brings with it plenty of things to do, people to see, and places to go. During the summer when everyone heads outdoors and there’s plenty to do, you’ll fall in love with the neighborhood. From the historic landmarks to the shops and eateries that line its streets, Fairmount offers an enchanting gateway into the past with modern convenience alongside.

Friendly Area

Friendly Area, Eugene is a neighborhood in the northwest corner of Eugene. The vicinity offers a ton of entertainment for residents and visitors alike. The streets are lined with boutiques, shops, and restaurants perfect for checking out. The area is close to downtown, but feels more suburban- the perfect combination for those who want the urban life without living right in it!

Average rent in Eugene

University life in Eugene

Eugene is home to both the University of Oregon and Lane Community College and provides plenty of opportunities for students to intern, which is great for getting experience on your resume and making connections. If you are looking for rooms for rent in Eugene and want to apply in the city, Emerald City has the feel of a small town with the amenities of a big city. Here are the top 5 universities to check out!

  • University of Oregon
  • Bushnell University
  • Lane Community College
  • Northwest Christian University
  • Franklin University

Related: Find Rooms For Rent In Louisville

How transit-friendly is Eugene?

If you’re an outdoor enthusiast, there are plenty of ways to get outside in Eugene without a car! Biking and walking are obvious choices. If you are looking for rooms for rent in Eugene, here are some other ways to get around the city.

Taxis

Eugene is a walker-friendly city with lots of bike lanes and public transportation options. Unfortunately, walking and biking can be ineffective in the bitter cold or torrential rain. At times like these, you can always depend on taxi services like Uber and Lyft. Taxi is also one of the safest modes to travel in if you don’t own a car.

Walkability

With 156,185 residents, the average walkability score of Eugene is 45 out of 100. West University, Downtown, and Jefferson Westside are the most walkable neighborhoods in the city. Eugene is also a bikeable city, so you can simply hop on your bike when you need to pick up groceries!

Public transportation

Public transportation in Eugene is provided by Lane Transit District (LTD). The LTD bus system has a fleet of 373 vehicles including small shuttles, large transit buses, and lift-equipped buses.

Cycling

Eugene has always been one of the most bike-friendly communities in America. With over 200 miles of paths and trails, there is no shortage of great places to ride. One particularly beautiful ride highlights a classic Oregon landscape – the Willamette River. This route follows a stretch of path along the river between West Amazon Park and Coburg Road.

Cultural activities in Eugene

Eugene is home to a unique mix of cultures and activities. In the heart of downtown, you’ll find people from all walks of life. Each day, they gather at local cultural landmarks for festivals, performances, and more! And often, these events are free or low-cost for the community.

The Eugene Oregon Area has many great things to offer in the way of outdoor recreation. With horseback riding, mountain biking, hiking, and just about any other type of outdoor activity you can think of, it makes for a wonderful getaway.

Sandboarding

Sandboarding is one of the most underrated activities in Oregon and even the Pacific Northwest! There’s only one place around here that offers trips like this, so if it appeals to your adventurous side (and who doesn’t like riding on sand dunes?) then don’t miss out. It’s SO much fun!

Hiking

Hiking just might be the best part of living in Eugene. There’s a plethora of trails to choose from that traverse through beautiful forests, up the side of hills with breathtaking views, and down to the Willamette River for some old-fashioned relaxation. Whether you’re looking for an intense workout or just want to enjoy nature, there’s a trail for you.

Nightlife

From dive bars to cocktail lounges and dance clubs, Eugene has a thriving nightlife scene that attracts both locals and visitors. In fact, the city is so fun, it was even named one of the “Best College Towns” by WalletHub!

Restaurants in Eugene

If you are looking for rooms for rent in Eugene and you are new to the city then with all of the incredible restaurant options, it’s hard to know where to go when craving something new. Luckily for you, we’ve done the research and compiled a list of some of our favorite eats around town!

Mezza Luna Pizzeria-

Located at 933 Pearl St, this downtown pizza restaurant offers delivery as well as sit-in orders. The vegetarian-friendly restaurant has a wide range of menu including finger-licking appetizers, desserts, salads, and gluten-free pizza. The best part about the award-winning pizzeria is that it offers catering services as well!

440 Cafe-

Located at 440 Coburg Rd, 440 Cafe is famous for its comfort food like fresh fish specials and Mac n’ Cheese. The eco-friendly cafe is open from Tuesday- Saturday from 11:30 am to 8 pm. If you have kids then you’ll be delighted to know that they offer a special kid’s menu as well!

Sabai Cafe & Bar-

Famous for its “Pacific Rim” cuisine, Sabai Cafe & Bar is located at 27 Oakway Center and brings the street food right from the lanes of Thailand onto our plates. So, if your taste buds ever crave exotic Asian and Thai flavors, this vegan-friendly Cafe & Bar is the right spot for you.

D’you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find rooms for rent in Eugene? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we help you find your perfect match! Download the app here and hop on the easiest ride home, ever!
